poem:
Title: A Stroll Down Abbott Street

Walking back and forth
on Abbott—each word 
steps upon the bitumen.
The locals whisper,
"Mad."
Old camphor laurels watch,
staghorns perched within their arm.
Quiet, long street stretches—
a testament to time.
Difficult it grows,
to harbor hope,
But within the leaf-silence,
amid the echo of passing steps—
optimism blooms,
unread newspaper left behind.
